column1: Art Institute of Chicago////A must-see for first-timers to Chicago. Reserve a full day as there is so much to see and you will need to pace yourself. The museum's collections of Impressionist
column2: Post-Impressionist and American paintings are simply impressive. There are more than thirty paintings by Monet as well as a collection by Renoir. Of course
column3: we had to see Grant Wood's "American Gothic" painting! Being a fan of Frank Lloyd Wright
column4: it was nice to see furniture pieces designed by him throughout the museum. The building itself is impressive especially the entrance on Michigan Avenue with the two iconic bronze lion statues.
